text: Tony Loffreda is a Canadian politician and former banker. In July 2019, he was appointed as a Canadian Senator representing the province of Quebec. He previously worked as a Royal Bank of Canada executive in Montreal. Loffreda is a Certified Public Accountant. He holds a Bachelor of Commerce from Concordia University, where he now serves on the board of governors. He was awarded a Sovereign's Medal for Volunteers for his volunteer work for various health related charities.
